title: Linux yes Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the versatile Linux yes command and learn how to use it to generate repeated output, combine it with other commands, and automate various tasks.

meta.description: Explore the versatile Linux yes command and learn how to use it to generate repeated output, combine it with other commands, and automate various tasks.
meta.keywords: Linux, yes command, repeated output, automation, command line, utilities

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the yes Command

verify.name: Verify the yes command output
verify.hint: The output of the yes command should be "y" repeated 5 times.

steps.title: Use yes Command to Generate Repeated Output

verify.name: Verify the yes command output
verify.hint: The output of the yes command with the argument "hello" should be "hello" repeated 5 times.

steps.title: Combine yes Command with Other Linux Commands

verify.name: Verify the yes command with rm
verify.hint: The yes command should have deleted the test_directory.

verify.name: Verify the yes command with dd
verify.hint: The yes command should have provided input to the dd command to write 10 MB of data to /dev/null.
